Data Wrangling

Author

Foad Sanjaran

Data Wrangling:

Code:

library(vroom)
library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)

ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  type = col_character(),
  number = col_character(),
  country = col_character(),
  date = col_date("%Y-%m-%d"),
  abstract = col_character(),
  title = col_character(),
  kind = col_character(),
  num_claims = col_double(),
  filename = col_character(),
  withdrawn = col_double()
)

patent_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/patent.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: type,
number, country, abstract, title, kind, filename, withdrawn
patent_assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/patent_assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: number,
country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
uspc_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/uspc.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
setDT(patent_tbl)

setDT(assignee_tbl)

setDT(patent_assignee_tbl)

setDT(uspc_tbl)
Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details,
e.g.:
  dat <- vroom(...)
  problems(dat)
class(assignee_tbl)
[1] "data.table" "data.frame"
colnames(assignee_tbl)
[1] "id"           "type"         "organization"
setnames(assignee_tbl, "id", "assignee_id")

combined_data_1 <- merge(x = assignee_tbl, y = patent_assignee_tbl,by    = "assignee_id")





colnames(patent_tbl)
[1] "id"         "date"       "num_claims"
setnames(patent_tbl, "id", "patent_id")

combined_data_2 <- merge(x = combined_data_1, y = patent_tbl, by = "patent_id")





uspc_tbl[, patent_id := as.character(patent_id)]
combined_data_3 <- merge(x = uspc_tbl, y = combined_data_1, by = "patent_id")





# First challenge

setDT(combined_data_1)

patent_counts <- combined_data_1[, .(n_patents = .N), by = .(assignee_id, organization)][order(-n_patents)]

top_10_patent_holders <- patent_counts[1:10]

view(top_10_patent_holders)


# Second challenge

august_data <- combined_data_2[month(date) == 8 & year(date) == 2014]

patent_counts <- august_data[, .(num_patents = .N), by = organization]

top_10 <- patent_counts[order(-num_patents)][1:10]

as.data.table(top_10)
                                   organization num_patents
 1: International Business Machines Corporation         718
 2:               Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.         524
 3:                      Canon Kabushiki Kaisha         361
 4:                       Microsoft Corporation         337
 5:                            Sony Corporation         269
 6:                                 Google Inc.         240
 7:                       QUALCOMM Incorporated         223
 8:                                  Apple Inc.         222
 9:                    Kabushiki Kaisha Toshiba         213
10:                         LG Electronics Inc.         211
view(top_10)

# Third challenge


patent_counts <- combined_data_3[, .(num_patents = .N), by = organization]

top_10_companies <- patent_counts[order(-num_patents)][1:10]

top_10_patents <- combined_data_3[organization %in% top_10_companies$organization]

tech_counts <- top_10_patents[, .(num_patents = .N), by = mainclass_id]

top_5_tech_classes <- tech_counts[order(-num_patents)][1:5]

view(top_5_tech_classes)
